titleStmt.title: George H. Pendleton and John Kebler to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1725

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To the Governor of
the Commonwealth of Kentucky,
Sir,

Robert A. Johnston is a member of the Bar of this county in good standing. He is fully competent to discharge the duties of a commissioner of Deeds &c for Kentucky, and we would recommend his appointment.

Respectfully,
Geo. H. Pendleton.
John Kebler
Gilmore Dunlass & Co
Banker 26 & 28 West Third st

Cincinnati Nov 25th 1863.
Governor Bramlette
Dr Sir

Enclosed you will please find $5.00 and references. I desire the appointment of commissioner for Kentucky, in Ohio to take deposition acknowledgment of deeds &c. I have procurred the recomendation of Geo. H. Pendleton Mem Congress, Mr. Kebler an old Attorney & one of the first Banking Houses. I would further refer you to Col Boyle now I believe
(over)
Your Adjutant General. Trusting this may prove sufficint I seen an

Yours Respectfully
Rob. A. Johnston
Nov 25th 1863.

Ohio
R. A. Johnston
Comr Deeds
Apptd.
28th Nov 1863
